description: Enterprise techniques used by FRP, ATT&CK software S1144 (v1.0)
name: FRP (S1144)

techniques.comment: [FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) has the ability to use HTTP and HTTPS to enable the forwarding of requests for internal services via domain name.(Citation: FRP GitHub)
[FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) can support the use of a JSON configuration file.(Citation: FRP GitHub)
[FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) can use STCP (Secret TCP) with a preshared key to encrypt services exposed to public networks.(Citation: FRP GitHub)
[FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) can be configured to only accept TLS connections.(Citation: FRP GitHub)

As part of load balancing [FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) can set `healthCheck.type = "tcp"` or `healthCheck.type = "http"` to check service status on specific hosts with TCPing or an HTTP request.(Citation: FRP GitHub)
[FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) can communicate over TCP, TCP stream multiplexing, KERN Communications Protocol (KCP), QUIC, and UDP.(Citation: FRP GitHub)

[FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) can tunnel SSH and Unix Domain Socket communications over TCP between external nodes and exposed resources behind firewalls or NAT.(Citation: FRP GitHub)
[FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) can proxy communications through a server in public IP space to local servers located behind a NAT or firewall.(Citation: FRP GitHub)
The [FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) client can be configured to connect to the server through a proxy.(Citation: FRP GitHub)
[FRP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1144) can use a dashboard and U/I to display the status of connections from the FRP client and server.(Citation: FRP GitHub)
